t: John 5
A Man Healed at the Pool of Bethesda
After*p this there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
Now there is in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate*i a pool, which is called in Hebrew, Bethesda, having five porches.
In these lay a great multitude of sick people, blind, lame, paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water.
For an angel went down at a certain time into the pool and stirred up the water; then whoever stepped in first, after the stirring of the water, was made well of whatever disease he had.
Now a certain man was there who had an infirmity thirty-eight years.
When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he already had been in*i that*i condition*i a long time, He said to him, “Do*r you*r want*r to*r be*r made*r well?”*r
The*p sick man answered Him, “Sir, I have no man to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up; but while I am coming, another steps down before me.”
Jesus*p said to him, “Rise,*r take*r up*r your*r bed*r and*r walk.”*r
And immediately the man was made well, took up his bed, and walked. And*p that day was the Sabbath.
The Jews therefore said to him who was cured, “It is the Sabbath; it is not lawful for you to carry your bed.”
He*p answered them, “He who made me well said to me, ‘Take*r up*r your*r bed*r and*r walk.’”*r
Then*p they asked him, “Who is the Man who said to you, ‘Take*r up*r your*r bed*r and*r walk’?”*r
But the one who was healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn, a multitude being in that*i place.
Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him, “See,*r you*r have*r been*r made*r well.*r Sin*r no*r more,*r lest*r a*r worse*r thing*r come*r upon*r you.”*r
The*p man departed and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
Honor the Father and the Son
For*p this reason the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill Him, because He had done these things on the Sabbath.
But Jesus answered them, “My*r Father*r has*r been*r working*r until*r now,*r and*r I*r have*r been*r working.”*r
Therefore*p the Jews sought all the more to kill Him, because He not only broke the Sabbath, but also said that God was His Father, making Himself equal with God.

Then Jesus answered and said to them, “Most*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r the*r Son*r can*r do*r nothing*r of*r Himself,*r but*r what*r He*r sees*r the*r Father*r do;*r for*r whatever*r He*r does,*r the*r Son*r also*r does*r in*r like*r manner.*r

For*r the*r Father*r loves*r the*r Son,*r and*r shows*r Him*r all*r things*r that*r He*r Himself*r does;*r and*r He*r will*r show*r Him*r greater*r works*r than*r these,*r that*r you*r may*r marvel.*r
For*r as*r the*r Father*r raises*r the*r dead*r and*r gives*r life*r to*r them,*ir even*r so*r the*r Son*r gives*r life*r to*r whom*r He*r will.*r
For*r the*r Father*r judges*r no*r one,*r but*r has*r committed*r all*r judgment*r to*r the*r Son,*r
that*r all*r should*r honor*r the*r Son*r just*r as*r they*r honor*r the*r Father.*r He*r who*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Son*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r Him.*r
Life and Judgment Are Through the Son

“Most*rp assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r he*r who*r hears*r My*r word*r and*r believes*r in*r Him*r who*r sent*r Me*r has*r everlasting*r life,*r and*r shall*r not*r come*r into*r judgment,*r but*r has*r passed*r from*r death*r into*r life.*r

Most*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r the*r hour*r is*r coming,*r and*r now*r is,*r when*r the*r dead*r will*r hear*r the*r voice*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r God;*r and*r those*r who*r hear*r will*r live.*r
For*r as*r the*r Father*r has*r life*r in*r Himself,*r so*r He*r has*r granted*r the*r Son*r to*r have*r life*r in*r Himself,*r
and*r has*r given*r Him*r authority*r to*r execute*r judgment*r also,*r because*r He*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.*r
Do*r not*r marvel*r at*r this;*r for*r the*r hour*r is*r coming*r in*r which*r all*r who*r are*r in*r the*r graves*r will*r hear*r His*r voice*r
and*r come*r forth—*r those*r who*r have*r done*r good,*r to*r the*r resurrection*r of*r life,*r and*r those*r who*r have*r done*r evil,*r to*r the*r resurrection*r of*r condemnation.*r

I*r can*r of*r Myself*r do*r nothing.*r As*r I*r hear,*r I*r judge;*r and*r My*r judgment*r is*r righteous,*r because*r I*r do*r not*r seek*r My*r own*r will*r but*r the*r will*r of*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r Me.*r
The Fourfold Witness
“If*rp I*r bear*r witness*r of*r Myself,*r My*r witness*r is*r not*r true.*r
There*r is*r another*r who*r bears*r witness*r of*r Me,*r and*r I*r know*r that*r the*r witness*r which*r He*r witnesses*r of*r Me*r is*r true.*r
You*r have*r sent*r to*r John,*r and*r he*r has*r borne*r witness*r to*r the*r truth.*r
Yet*r I*r do*r not*r receive*r testimony*r from*r man,*r but*r I*r say*r these*r things*r that*r you*r may*r be*r saved.*r
He*r was*r the*r burning*r and*r shining*r lamp,*r and*r you*r were*r willing*r for*r a*r time*r to*r rejoice*r in*r his*r light.*r

But*r I*r have*r a*r greater*r witness*r than*r John’s;*r for*r the*r works*r which*r the*r Father*r has*r given*r Me*r to*r finish—the*r very*r works*r that*r I*r do—bear*r witness*r of*r Me,*r that*r the*r Father*r has*r sent*r Me.*r
And*r the*r Father*r Himself,*r who*r sent*r Me,*r has*r testified*r of*r Me.*r You*r have*r neither*r heard*r His*r voice*r at*r any*r time,*r nor*r seen*r His*r form.*r
But*r you*r do*r not*r have*r His*r word*r abiding*r in*r you,*r because*r whom*r He*r sent,*r Him*r you*r do*r not*r believe.*r
You*r search*r the*r Scriptures,*r for*r in*r them*r you*r think*r you*r have*r eternal*r life;*r and*r these*r are*r they*r which*r testify*r of*r Me.*r
But*r you*r are*r not*r willing*r to*r come*r to*r Me*r that*r you*r may*r have*r life.*r
“I*rp do*r not*r receive*r honor*r from*r men.*r
But*r I*r know*r you,*r that*r you*r do*r not*r have*r the*r love*r of*r God*r in*r you.*r
I*r have*r come*r in*r My*r Father’s*r name,*r and*r you*r do*r not*r receive*r Me;*r if*r another*r comes*r in*r his*r own*r name,*r him*r you*r will*r receive.*r
How*r can*r you*r believe,*r who*r receive*r honor*r from*r one*r another,*r and*r do*r not*r seek*r the*r honor*r that*r comes*ir from*r the*r only*r God?*r
Do*r not*r think*r that*r I*r shall*r accuse*r you*r to*r the*r Father;*r there*r is*r one*ir who*r accuses*r you—Moses,*r in*r whom*r you*r trust.*r
For*r if*r you*r believed*r Moses,*r you*r would*r believe*r Me;*r for*r he*r wrote*r about*r Me.*r
But*r if*r you*r do*r not*r believe*r his*r writings,*r how*r will*r you*r believe*r My*r words?”*r
